Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 雑貨屋「雅々」
Entry.EnglishText: General Store

Entry.JapaneseText: 装飾品・道具屋
Entry.EnglishText: Accessory and Item Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『装飾品の陳列棚』 「商品見本用。 お申し付けくだされば、 商品をお出しします。」
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Accessories Display Case - "These are display pieces. Simply ask, and we will bring you the actual product."

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『割れた鍋の像』 底が割れた鍋の像。観賞用。 誰かが割ったわけではなく、 割れているのが、もともとの形。 もちろん割れているので、使えない。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Statue of a Cracked Pot - A statue of a pot with a crack on the bottom, for ornamental use only. The pot is not actually broken because it always had the crack. Of course, that makes it unusable as a pot.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『いななく馬の像』 ある著名な彫刻家がバルカに 作るはずだった巨大な馬像の試作版。 本物は作成途中に反対派の手によって 壊されてしまった。 店の主人が気に入っているので、 なかなか手放さない。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Statue of a Neighing Horse - A prototype for a giant statue that a famous sculptor was going to make in Balka. However, the real one was destroyed by his rivals while it was still under construction. The shopkeeper has taken a liking to this one, and refuses to sell it.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『こわい顔の像（非売品）』 面白半分で買った人がこわがり、 結局はいつも、店に戻ってくるので、 今は非売品になっている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Statue with a Scary Face (Not for Sale) - People who buy this statue often grow afraid of it and end up returning it. Currently, it's not for sale.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『大カレギア百科書 全８冊』 カレギアの事なら、 すべて書いてあるという百科事典。 ２５００万ガルド。 原則、セットでないと買えないはずなのに、 なぜか一冊だけない。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Great Callegean Encyclopedia: 8 Volumes - A set of encyclopedias containing all that there is to know about Callegea. It sells for 25 million gald. It's supposed to be sold as a set, but for some reason, a single volume is missing.

Entry.JapaneseText: この建物、最高級の防音加工を してもらったのに、変な音が 外から聞こえて来るのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've already soundproofed these walls with high end materials, yet there's still this odd sound coming through.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最上級を越える防音加工を してもらわなくちゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: Looks like I'll need to invest in higher quality materials...

Entry.JapaneseText: 色々取りそろえていますよ。 ごゆっくりご覧ください。
Entry.EnglishText: I have all sorts of products. Please take your time and look through them.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>何にしますか？ 装飾品を買う 道具を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>What can I help you with? Buy Accessories Buy Items Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: またどうぞー。
Entry.EnglishText: See you again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またどうぞー。
Entry.EnglishText: See you again.

Entry.JapaneseText: この隣に住んでる 物知りじいさんは 色んな事を知ってますよ。
Entry.EnglishText: The wise old man who lives next door knows a lot.

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、話半分に聞いといた方が いいですけどね。
Entry.EnglishText: However, it's best if you take his stories with a grain of salt.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>幻の庭<White>……？ ああ、また物知りじいさんの話？
Entry.EnglishText: The <Cyan>Garden of Illusions<White>...? Is that another one of the wise old man's stories?

Entry.JapaneseText: そんなのウソに決まってる じゃないですか。
Entry.EnglishText: Of course it isn't real.

Entry.JapaneseText: 大きな声じゃ、言えませんが ワン・ギン様は犯罪まがいの行為で、 今の財産を手に入れたそうですよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You guys didn't hear it from me, but apparently Wang Gin obtained his wealth through illegal means.

Entry.JapaneseText: とにかく黒い噂の 絶えない人です。
Entry.EnglishText: There are a lot of shady rumors surrounding him.

Entry.JapaneseText: オークションのお客さんで この街がにぎわうのは 悪い事ではないのですが……
Entry.EnglishText: It's not a bad thing for this town to be visited by a lot of auction-goers, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今ひとつスッキリしない 気分ですね。
Entry.EnglishText: Something about it doesn't sit right with me.

Entry.JapaneseText: また盗賊が出たんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Is it bandits again?

Entry.JapaneseText: いえね、 日常茶飯事なんですよ、 こんな事は。
Entry.EnglishText: "Again?" Well, this happens every other day.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近では街の者は あまり騒がなくなりました。
Entry.EnglishText: Though lately there haven't been any incidents here...

Entry.JapaneseText: 盗賊騒ぎも、いつもどおり 終わりましたね。
Entry.EnglishText: This bandit incident has ended just like they always do.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金のない人なんて あんなもんです。
Entry.EnglishText: Well, that's just how people without money are.

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサスで色々あったそうですね。 あの街にもお金持ちはいますけど、 本物じゃないんですよね……
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that a lot went down in Belsas. I was told that there are wealthy people living there, but I guess that wasn't the case.

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当のお金持ちは、 細かい事は気にしないから、 争ったりしないもの。
Entry.EnglishText: Actual wealthy people don't fret over the smallest things, which is why they don't get into fights.

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエンは、世の中の 騒ぎとは無縁の街ですよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen is a town free from this world's problems.

Entry.JapaneseText: やっぱり、お金の力かしら。 みんな心が広いのよね。
Entry.EnglishText: As I thought, people's hearts will always be open thanks to the influence of money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 世の中は大変な事になってる みたいですけど、平気です。
Entry.EnglishText: I hear that the rest of the world is going through tough times, but it's quite peaceful here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私、お金はたっぷりあるし、 いざとなればお金で何とか なるでしょうから。
Entry.EnglishText: I have lots of money saved up. If anything happens, I can just pay my way to safety.

Entry.JapaneseText: そうですね…… 最近、そう面白い話も ありませんねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: Well... There hasn't been anything interesting happening lately...
